name: Losers of Presidential Elections Multiple Choice Quiz | 10 Questions

questions.text: Lincoln, of course, was elected President in 1860. Whom did he defeat when he won re-election in 1864?
questions.explanation:
General McClellan.

	Generals and War Heroes are common candidates.

questions.text: Rutherford B. Hayes won a controversial election in 1876. Who was the unsuccessful candidate?
questions.explanation:
Samuel Tilden.

	Tilden won the popular vote, but the electoral college elected Hayes by one vote.

questions.text: Adlai E. Stevenson lost two elections to the same man. Name that man.
questions.explanation:
Eisenhower.

	As I said, war heroes are popular candidates.

questions.text: James Polk became President by defeating this candidate:
questions.explanation:
Henry Clay.

	He was a true 'dark horse' winner.

questions.text: How many times did William Jennings Bryan unsuccessfully run for President?
questions.explanation:
Three.

	He lost to McKinley (twice) and Taft.

questions.text: Winfield Scott was one war hero who ran for President - and lost. Who won?
questions.explanation:
Franklin Pierce.

	Scott was a prominent Indian fighter.

questions.text: Wendell Wilkie was an unsuccessful Presidential candidate when he ran against this man:
questions.explanation:
FDR.

	FDR was not ready to be unseated.

questions.text: Harry Truman confounded the experts when he won his election against this individual:
questions.explanation:
Thomas Dewey.

	Smith and Hughes lost in other elections.

questions.text: James Buchanan was Lincoln's predecessor in the White House. Who did he defeat to get there?
questions.explanation:
John C. Fremont

	Fremont was the first Republican party candidate. Lincoln would win on that ticket in the next election. Millard Fillmore was also a candidate.
